item.title:
R to @letsgetonchain: 9/ In our example imagine a user wants to deposit 1000 USDC into @aave on @base or swap 1000 USDC for OP tokens on @Optimism.
Bad news: under the hood, he has 300 USDC on @ethereum, 300 USDC on @arbitrum and 400 USDC on @zksync.
Good news: He doesn't even know any of it.

item.title:
R to @letsgetonchain: 6/ Finalized commitments by default.
If user funds are pre-locked in a smart wallet, the solver can safely execute on the destination chain immediately, no finality wait needed, because it can later claim those locked funds as repayment.
Cross chain latency solved!

R to @letsgetonchain: 1/ Ethereum UX has improved a lot thanks to account abstraction (e.g., gasless transactions, multisig) :
- EIP 4337 for new users - EIP 7702 for existing EOAs
Account abstraction is great, but Ethereum misses a layer of abstraction to compete UX wise: CHAIN ABSTRACTION
